title: Ukraine Steps Up Growing Campaign to Strike Within Russia
description: The stepped-up drone and missile attacks show a will to hamper the Kremlin’s military logistics, and to remind ordinary Russians of the cost of war.

title: Missing Sailor Donald Lawson’s Boat Is Found Off the Mexican Coast
description: Donald Lawson, 41, of Baltimore was training for a solo sailing trip around the world when he left Acapulco on July 5. His capsized boat, the Defiant, was found in the Pacific on July 24.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Floods Pummel Beijing
description: Also, evidence shows that Myanmar’s junta has increased its brutal attacks against civilians.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Deadly Russian Missile Strike Hits Apartments in Central Ukraine
description: Kryvyi Rih, the hometown of President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine, was attacked hours after he warned that the war was “returning to the territory of Russia.”

title: Drone Attacks on Russia Show Evidence of Ukraine’s Other Counteroffensive
description: Officials in Ukraine rarely discuss attacks on targets inside Russia, including Moscow. But video evidence shows an increasing effort to launch long-range strikes inside the country.

title: ISIS Affiliate Claims Deadly Attack at Political Rally in Pakistan
description: The death toll from Sunday’s suicide bombing, which targeted a political rally near the border with Afghanistan, rose to at least 54 people, an official said.

title: Saudi Arabia Will Host Talks About Ukraine’s Peace Plan, Diplomats Say
description: Envoys from nations including the United States, Brazil, China and India have been invited, but it was not clear who would attend, the diplomats said.

title: Extensive Minefields Impede Ukraine’s Counteroffensive, Military Experts Say
description: Russia has been using antitank weaponry against the Ukrainian forces’ mine clearing vehicles, an analyst said.

title: Israeli Court Ruling May Determine Democracy’s Fate
description: From Hungary to India to Brazil, how judges responded to attacks on their independence helped decide whether would-be autocrats prevailed in constraining the courts.

title: U.S. Nurse and Her Child Are Kidnapped in Haiti
description: This, along with other recent kidnappings, may signal the end of a brief respite, as gangs tighten their grip after being targets of vigilante violence.

title: At Least 5 People Killed in a Palestinian Refugee Camp in Lebanon
description: Rival factions have been fighting for three days, at times with heavy weaponry, in the densely populated Ein al-Hilweh camp in the coastal city of Sidon, south of Beirut.

title: What’s Happening With the Quran Burnings in Sweden?
description: The country has found itself caught between outrage over anti-Muslim actions and its commitment to free speech. Denmark has also wrestled with the same tensions.

title: Blast at Political Rally in Pakistan Kills at Least 43 and Wounds 200
description: An explosion at a political rally on Sunday in northwest Pakistan killed dozens of people and injured 200 more, officials said, the latest sign of the deteriorating security situation in Pakistan, where some militant groups have become more active over the past two years.

title: ‘We Are a Romantic Country’: On the Set of a Steamy Hit in Italy
description: Italy falls for “Mare Fuori,” a television melodrama about the inmates of a juvenile detention center who pass the time making out — when not scowling at or occasionally stabbing one another.

title: Russia’s Wartime Spending Raises Fears of an Economic Bubble
description: The economic strength has helped to maintain popular support for Vladimir Putin’s war, but some have warned the state-led spending is threatening the country’s financial stability.

title: Mysterious Object Found on Australian Beach Is Identified as Space Debris
description: A cylindrical object that was found in remote Western Australia probably came from an Indian rocket, Australia’s space agency said.

title: Who Paid for a Mysterious Spy Tool? The FBI, an FBI Inquiry Found.
description: After a Times report, the bureau canceled its contract with a government contractor that used the tool on its behalf. But questions remain.

title: At Least 2 Dead in Heavy Rains from Typhoon Doksuri in Beijing
description: Landslides and flash flooding threatened outer districts of the city, and more than 5,000 residents were evacuated from their homes, the authorities said.

title: Wagner Mercenary Group Will Stop Recruiting, New Recording Says
description: The recording, purportedly of the group’s founder, Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, appeared to signal that the mercenary force would continue operations but on a smaller scale.

title: Ukraine Recaptures Staromaiorske, a Glimmer of Success for Counteroffensive
description: Recapturing the village of Staromaiorske was such welcome news for the country that President Volodymyr Zelensky announced it himself. But formidable Russian defenses have stymied progress elsewhere.

title: Israel’s Justice Minister Is the Brains Behind Netanyahu’s Judicial Overhaul
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is the face of his government’s effort to reduce judicial power. His justice minister, Yariv Levin, is the main architect.

title: Moscow’s attacks are stoking hatred of Russia in Odesa.
Monday Briefing
description: Drone attacks in Moscow.

title: Could the Conflict in Manipur Become an Issue Modi Cannot Ignore?
description: India’s opposition is trying to force the prime minister to address the violence in Manipur, which has killed more than 150 people and displaced 60,000 others.
